subject: Investing
title: Dividend Tax Rates: Qualified vs. Ordinary
description: A short lesson to help you apply Dividend Tax Rates: Qualified vs. Ordinary.

hook.text: Two investors earned the same $5,000 in dividends. One paid 15% tax; the other paid 37%. The difference: qualification.

buildup.text: Qualified dividendsâ€”from US stocks held over 60 daysâ€”are taxed at the lower capital gains rate (0-20%).

discovery.text: Ordinary (non-qualified) dividendsâ€”from REITs, MLPs, short holdsâ€”are taxed at your income tax rate, up to 37%.

twist.text: Holding period matters. Sell a stock 59 days after the ex-date and the dividend becomes non-qualified.

climax.text: Place ordinary-dividend payers in tax-advantaged accounts and qualified-dividend payers in taxable accounts.

punchline.text: The tax rate on your dividends can matter more than the yield itself. Plan accordingly.
